intro: Agalmyla chrysostyla, commonly known as the golden-styled agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange ray flowers surrounded by a cluster of small, tubular disc flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and have a rough texture. Agalmyla chrysostyla thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
